Study_Design: Randomized controlled trial with serial MRI follow-up
Risk_of_Bias: Moderate - randomization by random number table but unblinded clinicians
Diagnostic_Criteria: MRI-confirmed solitary cysticercal lesion in cerebral parenchyma, new-onset focal or generalized seizures
Treatment_Type: Albendazole plus antiepileptics vs antiepileptics alone
No_Change_Percentage: 18.8% in stage 3 persisted unchanged for mean 17.4 months
Comments: No significant difference between albendazole and control groups in lesion evolution or resolution. Treatment only showed faster decline in perilesional edema at 3 months. Natural history follows predictable sequence over >1 year regardless of treatment.
